description: Southeast Asia is a region that has been deeply shaped by flows of ideas, peoples, and technologies, while retaining a cultural distinctiveness of its own. This module is an introduction to the complexity of Southeast Asian cultures and societies: ethnic and gendered identities that are often fluid and diverse; religious beliefs being reinterpreted and adapted to local needs; popular culture welcoming outside influences and cultivating local flavours. In this module, Southeast Asia is discussed as peoples, cultures and societies on the move, experiencing transformations and ever adapting to changes.
title: Societies and Cultures of Southeast Asia
